cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Honduras/Nicaragua border
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Central America, forecast to turn northwest into the south-central Gulf of Mexico and then track toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana vicinity) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (north-central Gulf Coast) after an earlier crossing of Mexico’s Yucatan Peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning only in effect for portions of the Nicaragua and Honduras coasts and Bay Islands (no U.S. coast at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: same as watch area – Honduras/Nicaragua coast and Bay Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Nicaragua and Honduras coast Friday, eastern Yucatán Peninsula Saturday, U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama (greatest risk Louisiana) Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained 34-kt (39 mph) winds late Monday night through Tuesday; occasional gusts possible in outer rainbands.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at this time for Galveston Bay/Houston Ship Channel – surge guidance keeps values below 3 ft with current track east of port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer-band showers could bring 1-3 inches of rain to the Houston metro late Monday–Tuesday, but widespread 4-inch totals are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased seas and long-period swells Monday–Wednesday may require small-craft advisories and could disrupt pilot transfers and lightering operations.
